ratings.comment: If you follow the rubric and prompt question for question you are most likely to get a good grade on ur essays. Show up to lectures, even though it may be boring (relevant to quizzes/attendance). And go to discussions, it's easy participation points and a good time to ask ur TA any clarifying ?s about essays. Opportunities for extra credit.
If you attend lecture, you'll understand the important parts of the readings even if you don't do them all. Essays very simple and easy.

Dr. Merz is a great professor and provided a lot of help during office hours. There weren't many assignments, and my TA wasn't a tough grader. This class is very manageable, and I recommend it to anyone looking to take it for a literature credit.

ENGL 242: Dr. Merz is a fantastic professor! She has such a genuine love of literature and takes an active role in the success of her students, doing her best to connect with them, be it through office hours or commenting on writing. The readings are relatively loose in terms of deadlines, and essays are graded very fairly. Would take again!
Dr Merz was super great

ENGL 242: This professor was readily available to students and extremely kind and encouraging. Her grading is very generous and the assignments are not overwhelming. You can take reading mostly at your own pace. A few downsides were her lack of technology skills and general lecture style made lecture a pretty rough sitting.

Kate is such a nice and caring teacher. If you listen in class and respect her, you'll have a great experience. She's very understanding about late work and extensions. Raise your hand at least every other class and you'll be fine. We have to write about 3/4 essays, but they're not harshly graded.
The best professor so far, excellent in any asepects you could imagine. The course wasn't difficult I just rated it 3 cz I learnt alot from it.

Dr. Merz is the best! She's funny and really cares about her students. Participation is a heavy part of your grade but she makes it very easy. She is good at checking in with all her students to make sure they're on track and she remembers small detail about students which shows she cares. Take her class!!!!

*English 144 not 100*

Kate, without a doubt, is the most kind professor I have had yet. She cares about her students just as much as her material. She is one of the reasons why I feel comfortable and optimistic about going to school at UW-Madison. If there is any advice I could give a freshman or sophomore, TAKE DR. MERZ's CLASS

Kate is an awesome professor! She is always willing to workshop your paper with you an gives great feedback. As long as you try and participate in the class, you will get a good grade. Course load isn't too heavy.

Kate was great. She had no problem explaining things again if they were initially confusing. She also gives great feedback on papers and assignments, and she makes class fun. She was a super easy grader; as long as you followed the instructions and put in decent effort you will likely get an A on papers. I highly recommend Kate for any class.

Dr. Merz is a very kind, helpful professor. She always does her absolute best to keep all students engaged during lectures, and I like how she makes them more discussion based and interactive. The papers can get to be a lot sometimes, but Dr. Merz leaves great feedback and is a lenient grader that wants her students to succeed. I recommend her!

Kate was my favorite prof. this semester. She was super caring and made sure that mental health came first. Kate was very accommodating when I needed to go home for an extended amount of time and always made the classroom a comfortable place to be.

Kate was a great professor! Especially with everything being online, she was super flexible. You could talk to her about any issues and she was very helpful. We wrote quite a few papers but she offered a lot of feedback and made the topics broad so we could write about basically anything we wanted. Would definitely recommend her!

Kate Merz was one of the nicest professors I was able to have in my freshman year of college at UW- Madison. I was in her English 100 class and I was very happy with my grade and the way she cared about how her students were feeling even outside of class. She was very respectful and was very understanding. Highly recommend!!

Dr. Merz was one of my favorite professors during my fall semester. She is very nice and gives you good/helpful feedback on your essays. During the course, there are a ton of short readings that you are require to read before discussion and then some short writing assignments in between that are 2-3 pages along with 3 writing projects.

Kate was a very nice professor and a fair grader. There were many "short" stories to read throughout the semester which typically had very political topics. Don't expect to get grades back quickly. She knows that we have other things going on which makes her very understanding. I would definitely recommend if you are looking for a chill professor.

Such an amazing professor! So friendly and willing to help you achieve in the class if you ask for help. Definitely was able to make a connection even though it was online! Definitely an easy grader and reasonable with participation. I would strongly recommend taking a class with Professor Merz! It was also an easy A which is nice too!
Super nice and understanding professor. Really easy grader as well.

Kate was a great TA/Professor, always gave good feedback to improve your essays before you turned them in and would always respond to emails and questions quickly. There were a lot of readings towards the beginning of the semester, but tapered off towards the end. Super understanding of everything and flexible based on your circumstances.
Kate was an awesome professor and super helpful. She gives great feedback on papers and is available for one on one help a lot.

One of the rare TA's who both knows their stuff and understands the flexibility sometimes required of quality work. She will touch upon things more insightful than either the professor or what one would expect of this course, all while being one of the nicest people you will meet. Take her, she makes up for our horrible professor.
Very helpful and accessible. Willing to go the extra lenghth to make sure everyone got what they needed out of the class. Also- one of the nicest people you will ever meet
very knowledgeable, helpful, and accessible.
